fields.value: Study of Earthquake Effects: Los Angeles and Sylmar, 1971 (M174V1)

dsDescriptionValue.value: This study was conducted with individuals living in the area immediately bordering the earthquake damaged hospitals in both Sylmar, and Los Angeles California. The topics covered include a 29-item version of the Rotter scale, experience and reactions to the initial earthquake, whether or not R was evacuated and nature of evacuation, extent of property damage to home and neighborhood, nature and extent of of emotional and physical injury to self and family,

publicationCitation.value:
1) Turner, Ralph H. Earthquake threat: The human response in Southern California. Institute for Social Science Research, University of California, Los Angeles, 1979

2) Benfer, Neil A., and Jerry L. Coffman, eds. San Fernando, California, Earthquake of February 9, 1971: Effects on building structures. 2 v. Vol. 1. US Department of Commerce, National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, 1973

producerName.value: Institute for Social Science Research, Survey Research Center.

fields.value: Social Science Data Archive. University of California, Los Angeles

otherGeographicCoverage.value: Los Angeles (Cal State LA) and Sylmar

value: Households in Los Angeles (Cal State LA) and Sylmar area

fields.value: A point midway between the hospitals (damaged) was taken and a 180' degree arc of 2 mile radius was cut. Starting from the central point, an attempt was made to obtain interviews from two houses on each major block. Major blocks are about 1/4 mile square. Block were selected prior to the interviewers entry into the area.
Face-to-face interview in Sylmar; Self-administered questionnaire in the Cal State Los Angeles area.
Structured questionnaire with some open-ended sections
